title: X, Y & Z are real nos. Can you prove that (X+Y+Z) ^2 >= 3 (XY+ YZ+ZX)? - The Math Guru - Quora

response.answer_text: (x+y+z)^2>= 3(xy+yz+zx) Expand (x+y+z)^2 x^2+y^2+z^2+2(xy+yz+zx) >=3(xy+yz+zx) x^2+y^2+z^2 >= 3(xy+yz+zx) - 2(xy+yz+zx) x^2+y^2+z^2 >= xy+yz+zx Here in L.H.S we have sum of Square values which we get a non-negative number In R.H.S we may get negative or non negative also So L.H.S is greater than R.H.S If we insert all values as either 0 or all as 1, we get both values equal. Hence L.H.S is greater than or equal to R.H.S
